channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Drop-down bollard not being used, 16th October
item.description:
The drop-down bollard at the pedestrian entrance to Jubilee Country Park (beside number 357) has been in the down position for weeks. When not being accessed by park staff this is supposed to be in the up position and locked. Any person in a vehicle who did not have permission could gain access to the park whilst the drop-down bollard is not in use.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large gas canister needs removing, 16th October
item.description:
Large dumped gas canister needs removing. I found it in the gutter and have put it beside the green box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aycliffe Close, Southborough, London

item.title: 69 hereford road light is out, 16th October
item.description:
Been out for months. pls fix it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 69, Hereford Road, Bayswater, London

item.title: Urine, spit and other to entrance, basement of bew court, 16th October
item.description:
Someone has been spiting over the landing and or say on the stairs spiting. This is on the way in and inside entrance to bew court (middle block) we have a good idea who is doing this. Continuously spitting as they walk in , go up and spit over/down. Although the person should be made to clean this up, neither have the cleaners and the inside to this block has not been kept or sanitised for a long time now. Same with the basement both NEED a good scrubbing!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dried urine, 16th October
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting. This area has not been cleaned for months. Bew Court Entrance to basement/bin & cleaners staff room area. Cleaners can clearly see this EVERYDAY! They have no intentions of cleaning it on thier own accord. It looks like someone has urinated behind the bin door and on top of dried urine that was never cleaned before that. Also a mix of sticky/spelt liquid from rubbish etc. We will not walk over it to take our rubbish down and therefore use the next block up which is also just as bad. What has happened to the lordship land estate. Itâ€™s a mess, yet we have more cleaners than we ever did before !!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Been abandoned bike for months now, 16th October
item.description:
This bike has been chained up to a pipe and dumped here for months. Has already been reported previously by neighbour. Does not belong to anyone and is in the way. It is in the basement opposite lift of Bew Court lordship lane estate. Where Southwark council cleaning staff reside

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Overhill Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flat 42 Balin House, SE1 1YH (Ground Floor), 15th October
item.description:
A black suitcase has been sitting on the ground floor for a couple weeks now with a very strong stench that is resulting in a foul smell in the hallways. I am not sure what is inside the suitcase but it is a horrendous smell - presenting a health and safety hazard to the tenants

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Long Lane, The Borough, London

item.title: I am unable to lock my bike, 15th October
item.description:
I am unable to lock my bike outside Marks & Spencerâ€˜s because the line bikes have taken all of the bike stands. The team inside Marks & Spencerâ€˜s say that they have contacted the council multiple times about this because their customers canâ€™t lock their bikes itâ€™s so frustrating this is like the fifth time. Why are Lime allowed to use all of the bike stands when their bikes donâ€™t even need locks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 446-450, Brixton Road, Brixton, London

item.title: Tree roots damaging driveway, 15th October
item.description:
The roots from the tree directly outside my property are pushing up the block paving on my drive causing damage and a trip hazard! Please can someone arrange to come and inspect the roots and arrange to remove the ones on my property. I have previously asked for this tree to be trimmed back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Chaucer Road, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Intercom doors not opening/locked out, 15th October
item.description:
Intercom doors not opening with fob or door number calling. We cannot get in to our homes unless a neighbour comes from their house to let us in. Having to press emergency exit from inside to open it
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Aden Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July, 15th October
item.description:
Overhanging trees from private land onto pavement - first reported 23rd July - Closed by Bromley Council 1st August having served a 28 day notice Not resolved by 1st Sept New report raised due to Bromley having closed the last one - This report closed today with - Bromley Council having served a 28 day notice New report raised 14th Oct - closed 15th Oct by Bromley Council with Bromley Council having served another 28 day notice. It's been 75 days since you served the first notice and 83 days since the issue was first reported! Bromley council, stop sending letters which aren't being acted upon and make sure people can use the pavement instead of being forced into the road by these trees and parked cars! You've had nearly 3 months to get this sorted!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Station Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet
